moves.5. Nb1 f6: looks like white is losing in development and tempo
moves.6. Bh4 e5: solid center but white has a different plan
moves.7. e3 Bxc5: it seems black is too strong and white has only develop his bishop
moves.8. exd4 Nxd4 9. Bd3 Ne7: slowly we see what white is planning
moves.10. Nf3 Bg4: black seems to make all the right moves but lets wait and see
moves.11. Nbd2 Nd5: good cover for knight on f3, white seems to only defend. i wonder when he is going to attack?
moves.12. c3 Nxf3+: exchange of knights, black still has the upper hand
moves.13. Nxf3 Nf4: black's knight looks dangerous, white is just beginning his master plan
moves.14. Bb5+ Kf7: good check and black mistake of putting his king on f7. what follows is a series of wonderful moves that only grandmasters make. i love the next few moves because it shows the beauty of the game and we should learn to 'never give up' when things look bad
moves.15. Nxe5+ fxe5: good move by black but too late
moves.16. Qxg4 Qc8: black tries to even the pieces and take some pressure of the king
moves.17. Bd7 Qc7: no choice but to wait for a slow and painful death by checkmate. he does the honourable thing that is resign.
